revised_title: Crystal Structure and Properties of Sperm-Whale Myoglobin
tldr: The authors studied the crystal structures of two forms of myoglobin extracted from sperm whale, type and type, and found that they have identical unit cell dimensions and virtually the same molecule. They also examined related crystal forms from other species and observed minor differences in amino-acid composition, but the overall structure remained consistent. This research contributes to understanding the structure and properties of myoglobin, a protein essential for oxygen transport in muscle tissue.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Molecular Biology
